I'm also not wild about the atmosphere-- I prefer my cafes a little seedier and funkier, this place is very slick and corporate cafeteria feeling.
My biggest complaint, however, is that the place is just so damn popular and crowded that there's nowhere to sit.
I've been by three times now, twice on a weekday afternoon and once on a weekend, and I have not once been able to get a table-- every damn spot is taken up by someone with a laptop.
I know that "working from home" is very hip but I just find myself gritting my teeth-- dammit, people, haven't any of you heard of a library, or the living room couch? I need a place to sit!!!
author: Sara G.

description: the macchiato is excellent (see my photo).  Also, the cornmeal cookie is great, but it's even better if you warm it up.
author: Scott F.

description: This place is so incredibly cute. Always have to wait in line which is unfort, but it's worth it. We get this stuff at work too, so I'm a bit hooked. I do appreciate the cute hearts they make in my coffee (even when it's to go!). The staff is friendly, the prices are better than starbucks, and the quality is way better. Also, wifi & ample table space? perfect for the college kid needing to work on a paper (... if only I was still in school?)
author: linda t.

description: Talk about obsessive, 70s french film, coffee love. I ordered a double espresso to go the other day, and the lad behind the counter gave me a troubled look and said,"You break our heart when you do that. Really. How about a double breve' to go?" So I relented, for I was weary of the struggle everytime I tried to order this. I mean, who wants to be known as the double-espresso-paper-cup-heartbreaker? Not me, mister! And you want to know what? You don't do you? I can tell. Okay, I'll tell you anyway. It was spectacular! They know their fucking coffee, man! You should see the way they feather the foam with crema, even that bullshit soy foam!  And the flavor, oh my, the flavor. I have to walk off a partial every time I take a sip of that espresso, (or now breve'). Add to that interesting people watching and screaming fast free wireless and I'm hooked.
author: Big S.

description: REALLY strong espresso combined with REALLY creepy music makes for an interesting time. It's also fun to watch couples sit at tables with their laptops and not talk to each other...
author: Nicolas H.

description: The BEST Hot Chocolate I've ever had, some really good Gingerbread, and fun conversation with a cute girl I shared the table with :) Can't wait to get back there again! Yay, I'm excited about moving in this neighborhood.
author: Anubhav J.

description: The coffee is excellent.  However, the people sitting around the cafe are all unfriendly and pretentious.  I've never felt such hostility in SF.  I'll take my coffee from Starbucks if it means I don't have to deal with the hipster attitude and intense BO smell permeating this joint.
author: Poker B.

description:
ok, so first i have to disclose that i only drink decaf coffee. 

assuming 99% of you just rolled your eyes and stopped reading, i will tell the rest of you that ritual makes the best decaf americano - totally smooth, without any weird aftertastes, as you so often find in decaf. you know a place is professional when they even treat us second-class decaf-drinkers right. 

also, even though they don't offer any decaf coffee on the clover machine, the tech geek in me loves watching that thing in action when someone else orders up a clover coffee.
author: Angi C.

description: I can't believe I was converted to the RCR madness. But I was. The people who work there, though fabulously "I spent a lot of time to look like I don't care about what I look like", are really really nice.  At first I was very self-conscious about going here, but then I thought to myself, "These people don't know that I'm not cool!" and I laughed and stopped caring.  It's not about me, it's about how damn good their coffee is.  The soy latte is unparalleled, and since I only live 5 blocks away, I have been through several coffee cards.  So, if you can get over your fear of other people who really don't care about you, in the end, you can enjoy the luscious coffee and laugh at the absurdity of a place that brings out "I'm not cool enough" high school attitudes.
author: Rhea S.

description: Fayantyastic!  They roast their coffee onsite so it's oh-so-fresh and deeeeeelicous!
author: Shum S.

description: The coffee is delicious and the servers are knowledgable about their craft.  However, it often gets crowded here so finding a seat or table proves difficult especially if you have a laptop.  There aren't many plugs so bring a charged laptop.
author: C T.

description: I was in a situation where I needed to find a non-divey coffee bar in the Mission that was open past 9pm.  I think most people will agree that this is a pretty difficult thing to find.  So I decided to try Ritual, knowing this was a "must-go" for the hipsters in the area.  I liked it okay - it definitely had the alternative vibe, was clean enough, and the seating was good.  Music felt a little loud for regular voice conversation, but not a dealbreaker.
author: Melinda C.

description: Sorry to crash the party, but too crowded, pretentious, yadda yadda...
author: David K.

description:
seriously perfect.

these boys and girls know how to make some fuck'n drinks. 

off the hook chai and the coffee is easily the best in the city and it's because of THE LOVE and artistry that is put into each cup. EACH CUP PEOPLE!!!! 

and if that weren't enough, they have cupcakes and vegan delights for your tummy.

thanks for making me over-caffeinated and fat.
author: K B.

description:
while you can clearly see the passion for coffee in this place, i couldnt get away from the acidic burnt flavor of the coffee here.
with high expectations... comes great disappointments.
author: Eitan S.

description:
Okay you get four stars. I really only wanted to give three, and sometimes one. But what the hell. Here goes:
The coffee is good. I'm still looking for something that blows my mind like a perfect Peet's espresso (shut up you anti-corporate hipsters who are wearing sweatshop made shirts, just because they're a chain doesn't mean they suck!) - sorry, just had to let that out. 
The baristas are all phenomenally competent and very quick for how busy it is and how intricate their drinks are. Even when extremely busy, they're also pretty polite. The people working the registers are hit and miss. I've given the up-down eyes-rolled looks on multiple occasions, and I've also been engaged with tons of coffee knowledge and a big smile about the same amount. All in all, it's the coffee place I'll take my visiting friends to when in the Mission, and I'll be satisfied with the product, which is more than can be said for many a coffee shop in this city.
author: Edwin M.

description: Yes, the coffee is good, but the atmosphere is stuffy (physically and spiritually) and always incredibly noisy. Can't talk, can't work -- what's the point?
author: Charlie Bolognese Z.

description: Good coffee, but I feel like more people come here to be seen than anything. Don't forget to bring your Powerbook.
author: Cheri S.

description: I've read soooo much about how great the coffee is at this place, but I don't need it served with such an attitude.  I didn't realize that working in a coffee place when you are well in to your 30s makes you really cool and that gives you the right to be an asshole, but apparently it does... My advice -- don't ever buy beans to take home, and if you do, don't ask for the "darkest roast" because you won't get it.  I think the person who gave me the coffee beans I ordered must have been pretty high if they thought that was a dark roast.
author: robyn s.

description:
Well well well. I just read a few not so forgiving reviews that aimed an air of self-dejected insecurity and some kind of unresolved inner bitterness at life towards this cafe's crew and coffees. I, however- not scared off by mesh hats, 70's tshirts, rainbow hair, NOR career going yuppies- have no problem entering the premises, watching the popular crowd, and getting a kick out of things while waiting in line. The hipster happenings add to the atmosphere here, and unless you have some weird new-age issue inside yourself, why would you care what the person was wearing if they serve really delicious coffee to you? Clearly you would be reviewing the staff's clothing choices, and not Ritual Coffee the cafe and the beans. But.... whatever. See, I quite  like yupsters and hippies and yelpsters alike, all the diversity makes for interesting! ( oh but I do love the underdogs best, whether once from small town Missouri, or geeks from New York City ;)
The coffee is adorable here. I mean-  it is to be adored. The freshly stamped container is as well, but that's just because the cup and the people and everything just feels like analog versus digital. You know, Ritual versus your corner Starbucks. I am even one of the rare indie kids that is OK with the S-bucks, but digital tain't nothin like that warm analog. Coffee and audio comparisons. I like this! Ritual feels raggedy and real, and I love that. Each cup of coffee is carefully and royally french-pressed. Dream come true for me. (I miss Portland some days) I didn't get to try an espresso this time. But the baristas were really nice, and everything ran efficiently. The art on the wall's was my husbands favorite art ever, and the crowd there was entertaining. It was a perfectly lovely shelter from the downpour. 

Thanks, Ritual! You are as yummy as Stumptown coffee.
author: Adrienne S.

description: Bizarre obsession with terroir at the expense of the roast.
author: Stephan M.

description:
a good cafe keeps things simple.

this place has nice, strong coffee + soft, delicious cookies + spacious room -- a winning equation, if you ask me.  the original arts on the walls are bonuses.  

i read reviews that this place attracts hipsters.  i guess they can't be that bad if they like good coffee.
author: Andrew P.

description:
damn, that was a good latte. i mean, REALLY good.
this place makes me rethink my entire existence.  what am i doing? why am i here? who am i? why am i applying for jobs in sterile office environments with wall-to-wall carpeting and wall-to-wall carpeted cubicles?
ritual was packed w. happy-looking people on their laptops.  it was also packed with happy-looking people engaged in interesting conversation.  i assume they're freelancing or students? doesn't matter. they somehow manage to sit in a cool coffee shop and drink delicious lattes all day.
i've got to figure out how to do this.
author: Mary C.

description: Second best coffee in the city after Blue Bottle Coffee. Staff is quirky, sometimes a little absent minded but often friendly, and it takes an incredibly long time to get served. Atmosphere is fun, but quite edgy. Desserts are not so great.
author: Eater S.

description: Best coffee ever with this amazing micro foam that I have never had before.  I stopped by on a Sunday morning and got some chai tea and a latte.  The coffee was delightfully smooth with no weird acidic or bitter after taste and the chai tea was not sticky sweet or super pungent.  The spiciness was just perfect!!!  I also got cranberry rosemary loaf and gingerbread loaf.  The two pastries were okay, nothing too spectacular.  Also, the customers certainly could use some humble pie.  Whatever happened to good old patience and not looking so constipated because there is a line/crowd waiting for their coffee too?  I was happy to get my coffee to go.  4 stars for the drinks alone though.
author: DJ P.

description: I enjoy staring at the hot hipster boys that work here.  I know they want nothing to do with me, but the eye candy is much appreciated.  The coffee isn't bad either, but it's expensive.
author: Katie H.

description:
coffee: 5 stars
matching Mission clone kiddies clogging the line and hogging all the tables: 0 stars
author: slapaham s.

description:
If you have a chip on your shoulder about "too many hipsters" or baristas that really know what they're doing and "take too long", go to Starbucks and shorten the line for me and everyone else who appreciates specialty coffee.

Seriously though.  If you really love coffee, you should be dividing your business between Blue Bottle and Ritual they are just worlds ahead of anyone else.  If anyone else in SF comes close, I'll update this review.
author: Oliver F.

description: Perhaps the coffee is good, I don't like coffee so I wouldn't know.  What I do know is their "hot chocolate" was steamed milk with a vague chocolate aroma.  It was possibly one of the blandest, most disappointing hot chocolates I've ever had.
author: Ben G.

description:
Pros:  Excellent quality coffee and espresso drinks.  Espresso is not over extracted and milk is steamed and poured to perfection.  Get a cap and they WILL make you a true cap with espresso infused into the foam due to perfect technique.

Cons: Long wait.  This place is busy, mostly filled with "hipster" types, but what else do you expect?  It is The City after all...
author: Janelle S.

description: Downgrade; the coffee roasting is good; the French press coffee is a good touch.  Downgrade is primarily due to customer experience that is less than a ideal for having a conversation; a very loud voice or even a little yellin' might help.  The music is far too loud and quite uninteresting.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description:
This is basically my Stumptown/Intelligentsia replacement in the City.
First off, I love the Mission and this place is right in the middle of some really awesome stuff (Dosa, Range, Weirdfish, Self Edge, Minnie Wilde, etc. etc.).  Next, the space is pretty open and airy, replete with roaster that is actually put to work in the middle of the day.
Also, although people complain of the staff 'tude I just moved from the land of nasty service so I am used to about any kind of abuse or injustice that can be shoved my way.  Actually, the first time I went in one of the guys actually came over and sat down to chat with me (who would have guessed).  
Now the actual coffee is quite unique.  Their espresso beans have a caramel essence (even sweeter than Vivace's) leaving me free to consume my Machiato without my usual sugar addition.  The americano was perfect and this left me quite happy and jolted for the day.
The pastries looks less than appetizing, but while studying for the bar this is a godsend....no need to add any additional pounds these next two months!
author: Sheila Y.

description:
thank you for having a clue. no thank you to mixing up my double cappuccino for a single, despite my correcting you. single shot anythings don't belong on the menu...you might as well just serve well-steamed milk. 

the second time around, i got my double cappuccino and it was great. thanks for the free wireless, as well.

oh, i tried their clover coffee. funky, but i'm not all that into coffee. i'd prefer a french press over this and in fact, i think they serve french press instead of drip here, cuz i see the barista making french pressed coffee constantly and filling a coffee thermos type thing with it, which is where i'd expect the drip to go.
author: Trogdor B.

description: I want to give them 4.5, because the coffee is variable (probably owing to their perpetual lineup), but it's been better lately, and it's a very comfortable place to spend a few hours. Their wifi is pretty good in my experience, and there are always friends around, even though I've only been a few times in the past 6 months.
author: Blaine C.

description: Everything I could ever really want from my neighborhood coffee joint.  Good for the chill-out-with-a-book all day, meetup-with-random-acquaintance-from-out-of-town day, low-key-work-stuff day, and for stopping it for a little caffeine and an entertaining scene.  It's not the place for you if you seek a quiet, distraction-free environment.  Since I like a little noise and bustle, this place has practically become my second home.  I especially love them for having lots of couches where I'm bound to find a place to hole up for a while.  The wide selection of vegan breads often gets me.  And of course, the coffee is excellent.
author: Natalie S.

description:
okay, so i just moved here from chicago and i guess i'm still a little bit confused. explain to me again WHY we hate hipsters so much?

i, in no way, identify or have been identified as a hipster (though i do sport  a chrome messenger bag and large red, round sunglasses occasionally), i just don't get it. i realize they are obnoxious every once in a while (as are non-hipsters), but i've never seen such hipster-hate before.

that being said, i've visited ritual a couple times and seen the flocks of hipsters that hang out here. but, spotted within that crowd...(gasp!)...normal people! (gasp!) ...enjoying their coffee!

ritual seems like a cool place to hang out, with their:

- hipster love/hate drama 
- international coffee beans in big bags of burlap being roasted
- communist-themed decor
- deellllliccciioouuss (vegan) donuts and donut muffins
- bike racks outside the building
- delicious coffee (i hear)
- roasting and selling of their beans in the building (3/4 lbs. for $12-$15)

sucks:
- hipster love/hate drama
- little to no outlets (the only ones that i've found are in the front and back of the store by the couches, if you need them)
- $6 credit/debit card minimum
- 'tude given when you order decaf?
- the environment and ethos doesn't work for me, personally---though i think that ritual is great at what it is

if you come here, just calm down with the hipster hating. you can still love ritual even if you don't love the 'sters.
author: Tara T.

description: The ultimate for espresso drinks (along with Blue Bottle).  Great place to hang out, if you can get a seat. ;-)  Even if you manage to score a seat, though, working/reading there can be tough, unless you bring ear plugs, as they like to blast the music, perhaps to drown out the yapping (good selections, to be fair ;-).
author: Ari M.

description: Great coffee. Very lively. Very friendly staff. Clean. Good place to work or not....
author: Stacy F.

description: I love me some delicious espresso and, after a few mistrials on my recent San Francisco trip, Ritual, sweet Ritual, did not disappoint. Mmmm.
author: Kandace B.

description:
if u truly appreciate really good coffee & baristas who know what they're doing then this is the place.

oh the lattes are so pretty and creamy i want to photograph them.  they truly are beauuuuutiful - inside & out.  

aah, it reminds me of Melbourne, Australia...the best coffee outside of Rome...i was a Melb coffee snob and am proud to say so...Ritual is the only place in SF that compares.
author: Christine R.

description:
Walking into Ritual Roasters is like walking onto the set for an Apple TV commercial shoot. I looked down the line at the tables and everyone of them had a MacBook in use. Just my kind of place.

It wasn't the computing I came for. I'd heard they had a Clover machine here and since I was in the neighborhood buying tickets across the street at Aquarius Records I decided to get a caffeine fix. The line moved quickly and it was all espresso-based drinks. When my turn came I asked for a Clover drip. I expected a little bit of attitude given this drink requires a bit more time and there was still a line behind me but the gal taking my order couldn't have been cheerier. I watched as she weighed out my beans to the exact bean and put it in the machine. We chatted about the bean varietals they were serving that day. We chatted about how some folks order the best cup of coffee in San Francisco and then go add cream and sugar and wonder what the hype is about. The coffee was soon brewed and I paid my $4.50 and went to sit in the sun. Best brewed cup of coffee in town...at least until I get to the new Blue Bottle with their new thigamajig machine. 

Here's to the caffeinated life!
author: Gary C.

description: Pretty good place. The crowd is cool and the coffee good (though not as good as blue bottle or some others). There's a good amount of table space and lots of laptops but no plugs. That may be a good thing because if there were you wouldn't be able to find a seat. I've been here since 4:00pm on Tuesday and have only see a couple empty tables. I recommend getting a cup of specialty clover coffee and not the house stuff.
author: Zac w.

description: Stopped by after a meal at Dosa. The place was crawling with hipsters, so I felt right at home (yeah, right). I ordered a small (8 oz) latte, which is the size I prefer because I like to taste the espresso and just offset it some with milk, not get a dominant milk taste. Somehow, despite supposedly having 2 shots as the standard even for the small cup, I could barely taste the espresso. It was a smoothly poured, pretty little latte, but didn't meet my needs. Maybe it was the spices from Dosa?
author: Scott M.

description: Ritual is a really cool coffee house. I find their logo reminds me of mother Russia. Their space is big and if you have good luck or timing you might be able to grab seats on the leather couch & singletons just inside and to the left . . . they're mighty comfortable. In the corner right next to them are power outlets that they offer to customers, except on the weekends. It seems like a very well run place. I had a triple latte in a to-go cup before heading off to a hike. Their presentation was applaudable and the taste was just how I like it. I recommend this place on all counts.
author: Todd F.

description: The coffee here get 4 stars but the service has made me lower the rating to three. It is a great place however the staff has a bit of a chip on their shoulders. It good be the time or day that you go but I think if you are serving coffee and drinking all that caffeine you would be ready to go and serve your customers with a smile, or at least that is what I like.
author: Madeline T.

description:
now this is a place that knows how to make espresso drinks.  these are the real baristas!  indeed they are.  excellent craftmanship and tasty coffee drinks.
it's pretty crowded though.
i like the interior, looks clean and inviting.
author: charlotte s.

description: I finally made it here this visit after not knowing where I was headed last time I was in town, and I'm glad I'm here.  I don't drink coffee and only had the tea, but the overall vibe here is wonderful.  Laid-back and a great place to work.  Sure, I'm one of those people that likes to camp out and sometimes I hate being one of "those people," but if that can't be avoided, this is where to do it.  It's got the vibe of a Seattle coffee shop, which is definitely a good thing.  Also, tasty cupcakes.  I just got the tiny one (chocolate with chocolate) and it was a great complement to my tea.
author: Donte P.

description: Lately, I've been on a mini-tour of coffee shops around the bay area trying to find the best coffee in town. Well, I must say that Ritual is by far one of my favorites! The staff is knowledgeable, the cafe is light and airy, and the coffee is great! I'm giving this place 4 stars (not 5) because we thought the latte was a little too milky. However, all in all, this is a great place and I would definitely recommend it.
author: l. a.

description: I'll probably never spend more than a few minutes in this place because it is notoriously packed with the aforementioned sea of laptops, but it's very much worth taking a detour from my intended journey to get a lick of their crazy good drip coffee.  I've sadly been attached to extra light coffee for years, and this is the only coffee I drink black with a hint of sugar.  It's that flavorful and pleasant, and worth braving the sea of hotties and lap tops.  Accomodating and fun staff in general is a plus in a typically hoity toity coffee town.
author: Lindsay B.

description: Stumptown is among my very favorite coffees in the world.  This place has great space.
author: Abendigo R.

description: Unfortunately, it was too late for me to have coffee, but the carrot cake that I had was delicious and bite size.  Perfect size to get a sweet after dinner sweet without tons of guilt!
author: Jane L.

description: I really hate it when people insist on one coffee shop being "the best." The amazing thing I love about coffee is that there are so many ways to enjoy it. It is, after all, an extremely diverse beverage, and I hold the greatest respect for my fellow growers, roasters, and baristas. That being said, almost any good coffee establishment does one aspect "the best." Ritual's thing lies in their espresso and espresso drinks. The first time I tasted their iced latte was on a rare, hot SF day. The moment that delicious, molasses and smoky taste hit my lips I was at once transported to a shady porch, felling so relaxed and happy. Sorry, was I gushing? It really is that good.
author: Adrienne F.

description: I came in this place. I mean, I didn't *come* in it, I *entered* it. I had a soy cappucino and a cheddar chive scone thing and it was really fuckin good. And the cappucino had nice swirly designs in it. They were playing MIA when I entered and I said it's cool that you're playing MIA and she didn't even give a shit! Then again, would I care if someone asked me that as I'm makin some yuppie their fuckin latte? Anyway, it's a place where you can get coffee and think you're really cool.
author: Tina P.

description:
heard much about this place and really wanted to do a taste comparison against my current fav coffee brand - blue bottle.   could not believe how unbelievably long the line was... waited more than 30 mins just to pick up coffee beans.  

the verdict is in - i give blue bottle the edge, more convenient for me.  however, i believe the hype.

they also use clover organic milk.  me likey.

in addition, noticed lots of yuppies and macbooks.  just an observation.
author: Dorothy L.

description:
for as much shit as people talk about this place, i've also heard praise.  so i had to go find out for myself.  

it was one of those lovely thursday afternoons. crossing the threshold i braced myself to be overwhelmed by glowing mac books and their users chasing that next web 2.0 prospect, but i only say 3 laptops in the whole joint.  i ordered a mocha (not on the menu. why?) and one of those vegan donut things (actually delicious).  both were quite tasty!

they were playing that Blackalicious - Blazing Arrow album.  what? i was expecting to hear some shit that doesn't come out til next year. i instead found myself distracted from my book with the urge to sing along to the tunes i knew.

all in all a lovely experience.  perhaps the weekends are a little more of a scene or something, but i was pleasantly surprised by the coziness.
author: Dan F.

description:
atmosphere: very spacey lots of seating, but is usually pretty full
service: less than kind, but reasonably fast
drink: I would only order an espresso or a drip, everything else is NOT there specialty 
price: overpriced
over all: great place to lounge around in the mission and people watch
author: A D.

description: Best tasting Americano I've ever had. End of story.
author: Katie A.

description:
i do enjoy the local feel of this place.  it's trendy and of course hipsterish.  plus the coffee is pretty good here.  however, i was definitely a bit disappointed in regards to it being a great internet cafe.

yes, their wifi is free, but the signal strength was weak and connection speeds were slow.  there were also a lack of power outlets spread throughout the cafe.  i looked around and simply couldn't fine any.  so i looked around at other laptoppers, and none of them were plugged in as well.  hmph...

overall, i'd come back here for their coffee and to catch up on my reading.  otherwise, i'm walking one block up to 'mission creek cafe' since they have a better set up for internet junkies.
author: Daniels L.

description:
solid, solid coffee from Ritual.  due to location, i've only been into the cafe once and bought some limited edition beans from Columbia and had a perfect macchiato.  the beans have really complex layers of flavors and i'm clinging on to the last of the beans.  the espresso was near perfection.

it seems to be a big hang out around 5pm for hipsters who need free wifi?

anyway, i'll return again and let the coffee sway me.  i prefer blue bottle only because i'm much closer to it and drink it way more, but my coffee addiction is always open to good coffee wherever it may be.
author: Annalea I.

description: One of my favorite places for any time of day.  Nighttime provides great lowkey conversation atmosphere...or a coffee-lovers style cup of coffee. I  love the decor, the space, and the lighting.  The owners tend the counter, so there's still that special love in the service.
author: Robby T.

description: These guys know their stuff. Excellent espresso served by talented baristas, in an environment that is geek-friendly (with wi-fi, natch) and is also a great place to just meet someone for coffee talk. It can get pretty crowded on most evenings, especially near the power outlets ;) I guess that's the only drawback. Try the Gibraltar! I also buy their whole beans for my at-home fix, which is excellent.
author: Courtney P.

description: Found it by accident. Get the "gibraltar." A lot of it is hype and coffee snobs, but they know their stuff for sure.
author: matt c.

description: I like Ritual's atmosphere and its free stable wifi connection. Their coffee it's a little too acidic to my taste but the pastry selection is good. I especially like to have an alfajor to go with my coffee. Maybe my torso is too short but i feel like either the table is too high or the chair is too short. It's not too comfortable to have my laptop on the table while i am sitting on the chair. Sometimes, there is a line to get coffee but it goes pretty quickly.
author: Hinling Y.

description: The coffee is great...tough to beat to say the least.  However, it really is loud.  So, if you are looking for a good cup of joe and a place to do some reading/work, this is NOT the place even though there are droves attempting to do so.
author: Brent R.

description: For a bunch of Bolsheviks, they certainly design a lot of websites.  The Commie coffee shop is hip and that's why I feel out of place there; it's always the first day of freshman year at the Hammer and Sickle.
author: Patrick A.

description: I like the coffee here; the salted chocolate cupcakes rock; and the people-watching can't be beat. (Hello scenesters!).  Only gripe is that the music is frequently too loud for me to concentrate on work or conversation, and it's too damn crowded. Can rarely get a table.
author: Elle B.

description: Primordial cappuccino. Haven't tried the vegan doughnuts, but might be the next great adventure.
author: Margaret K.

description:
what happened?????????????
the cup of coffee I had the other day tasted terrible! seriously,this place is so much fun to sit and drink coffee and people watch for hours.sometimes the art is cute and the lattes used to be divine. I think they just got overwhelmed by the crowds and started burning their coffee. yuck
2 stars for ambiance and one star for vegan donuts. no stars for coffee
author: Jayne M.

description: In sum - Ritual is a great little coffee shop.  Set amidst the colorful Mission district, Ritual is commonly filled to capacity with locals hanging out, working, reading... perhaps this is the only real downside - it is rather hard to find a table.  Furthermore the decor and atmosphere could be tidied up a bit.  BUT most importantly the coffee - it is downright delicious.  As a long time barista, whose pallet was honed amidst the plethora of boutique coffee shops of Seattle - Ritual certainly is one of the finest cups of coffee I have had in my life.  So if quality of barista and bean is your barometer of quality - look no further than Ritual.  But if you want to take a seat and soak up the atmosphere or work - you could find yourself waiting a while for a free spot or feeling a bit cramped.  But I love Ritual and will be back many times.
author: Zachary K.

description:
ambiance
kinda open warehousey kind of feel. lots of wood tables. lots of MacBooks (including my own), free wifi but no outlets (booo!). 

drinks
simple list of espresso drinks, and coffee. i had a latte and it was pretty strong with a heart swirl in the foam in my cup. it wasnt bitter at all, more robust. in comparison Blue Bottle is smoother in taste. 

food
not much. they really have a simple menu, i had a small pastry. 

service
short line, pretty friendly...hipster peoples on staff!

parking
gotta look for it, goodluck!
author: Courtney E.

description:
unless you're a hipster hater, you'll love this place.  the coffee is impeccable, perfect, delicious.  and i was a blue bottle loyalist!  Stumptown selects some of thee best coffee in the world, and the trained barristas at ritual brew it up perfectly.
divine coffee.
now--disconnect the damn wireless, outlaw the laptops, clean up the tables a bit, and get some better pastries.  that case looks janky!  I tried something only once, and it was rock hard and flavorless.
otherwise, if you just need a perfect cup of coffee, its spot on!
author: Kenzie D.

description: The latte's they make are for moi to dream of (or be hooked on.)  They no longer have all the wall plugs available for laptops which is understandable.  But I enjoy their San Francisco urban ambience.
author: Enric T.

description: Ever heard of Stumptown coffee? Voted #1 roaster in the US more than once & served by award winning baristas? Ritual KICKS ASS as they have followed in the steps of the Roasted Mothership Stumpy from up north. Ritual has now chosen to seperate themselves and start roasting thier own.  And it is out of this world perfectly blended. Locals know it as you see a line out to the door all the time. Who cares about the laptops, tatts and lines?! This coffee is worth standing in the cold rain of hipsters for. I go out of my way every time I am in town as their coffee has no competition for smooth, frothy, rich, darkness that I want to just to slide naked into SF. aahhhh...first sip XXX-tasy.
author: Daniel P.

description: Fabulous coffee. No attitude. Fun albeit  a tad pricy. A keeper.
author: Jeff T.

description: It was a sunny day in the Mission when I came into Ritual to meet a friend. The place has a huge emphasis on coffee which was way too tempting for someone who is trying to lay off on the bean. I thought it was really cute, though, that they had a different coffee everyday and that they're from all over the place. Luckily, they do have a decent tea collection and I was able to stick to my cold turkey. The ambiance includes everything a cafe should have.
author: Annelise L.

description: Good coffee. Bring your computer. Love the guy with the mustache. The little cupcakes are better than the big ones.
author: Katherine K.

description: My first ever review I kind of feel nervous it's almost like a first kiss but everyone can look anytime they want at the review not me kissing. The spot I went to was"Ritual Coffee" w/ my girlfriend. She wanted me to try it out because she went there w/ her coworkers for a business meeting, the coffee was awesome. The coffee was tasty and strong but the flavor was not to bold as my fav coffee house "Blue Bottle" that is not a bad thing. The coffee tasted smooth to match its ambiance. When we arrived there the shop was having an art show and at each booth there was art piece to observe, nice!  "Ritual" is cool spot to explore for coffee plus they have wi-fi a standard all coffee shop should have if they want me to return personally. I rate this place 4 because of the great tasting coffee and solid environment. I advise to get the mocha very yummy. I think 5's should be given out to places that have no competition or alternative.
author: Roy L.

description: I haven't been there since the changed their espresso blend, but their Sweet Tooth espresso blend was bright, citrusy, and enjoyable as an espresso; its acidic nature allows it to perform in milk as well.  They have friendly baristas with some serious skills - last time I was in, my coffee came from Chris Baca (probably one of the top baristas in the country).  One of the few places I make sure to visit everytime I am in the city.
author: Andrew C.

description: After entering, I usually look for a spot to sit right away. It seems like no matter what time it is, you might be unfortunate enough to end up awkwardly sitting next to someone on a couch as you two make nervous side glances to each other. Don't even bother waiting, there are plugs everywhere and those kids with their iBooks are there to stay. The music's usually too loud to get any studying done nor the space intimate enough for it to be one of those cafes to get to know someone. I'm surprised though by the cleanliness of the place! With that many people, I don't know how they maintain it, from the bathrooms to the cafe tables. The soy latte with a perfect rosetta and a wink from the barista is what I come back for to this otherwise yuppy, overpriced, almost pretentious place for coffee. A plus: this is the latest closing cafe in the Mission area that I know of  11 PM!
author: Amar A.

description:
The best brew in town
 With delicious home baked treats
Staff is tasty too
author: HaikuReview X.

description: Are you ready for some divine coffee??? The lines to get coffee in this place are insane, sometimes it starts on the street outside. The aroma of the coffee reaches you from a block away. There is always a lot of energy going around this place with never a dull moment. If you buy a pound of coffee from here it seems to keep its freshness a lot longer than either Starbucks or Peet's
author: Belinda w.

description: Hipsters are very clearly people who were tortured in high school, who find that the only way to be cool is to be hip.  When I walk into this place, I see a bunch of ugly-ass, insecure annoying hipsters all over the place.  I see them giving attitude to all the other hipsters and customers, treatin' peeps like they were treated in high school, no doubt.  God, why did you make my Mission hipster-central?
author: rerun w.

description: I got coffee here when I visited a friend in SF. They were doing some sort of bike marathon with GIANT bags of coffee strapped on their backs (who you ask...seemingly random cyclists) to send bikes to kids in Africa (I think). SF was a trip!
author: John S.

description: a cute coffee cafe' hidden in Mission..i love their canvas art interior..very colorful w/ lots' of coffee roastery beans that smell like heaven!!  very one of a kind roastery; compare to cafe's like Starbucks; Peet's.
author: Sarah M.

description: Went there today, and the guy on the pour over bar(around 2pm) was awesome. I forget his name(something sort, like Irv or erin or brie) Any way he was genuinely excited about coffee, which seems to be such a rarity in this industry. Ive worked in coffee for 10 years and most people a cafes here in the bay area look like there hating every minute of what there doing. Even though it was busy, he was carrying a conversation with me about brewing, pour overs, temp loss, etc. It was a breath of fresh air talking to someone who cared and was excited about what he was doing.
author: Coffee N.

description:
Excellent coffee, but they haven't made any attempt to improve their service since they opened.  The line is always out the door, there is no seating, and no space to fix your coffee when you get it.

Unfortunately, the only serious change the management has made since they opened was to close the outlets on the weekend, raise the prices, and add a new fangled machine that nobody uses.  None of these actions improved the wait time or the quality of service, so they aren't getting my business. and yeah they'll still make great coffee and plenty of $$, but I feel better supporting establishments that care about their customers.

And I don't know what people are thinking, but it'd be annoying as hell to navigate a wheelchair around the line out the door, the bikes and smokers blocking the sidewalk, and the line at the fixings just to find out they counter isn't reachable from a wheelchair.
author: bri b.

description:
Okay, I don't understand.

My best friend took me and another friend to this place, raving about how she had the most amazing macchiato ever. Her opinion is one I have a lot of regard for, so we made the trek, even though I'm not as big on coffee as my two friends are.

I ordered an espresso, and they ordered a macchiato and a cappuccino. 

The cappuccino was good enough. We all split it.

The espresso and macchiato were SO, so, so off. I don't just mean kind of bad. I mean SOUR, and CRUSTY on the top and bottom. Pretty freaking bad.

Since then, my friend has gone another time and said her drink was fine.

I'll rewrite this review once I feel like bothering to go back--for the time being, it doesn't seem worth the effort.
author: Anna M.

description: Amazing coffee! Refreshing to find a no-bullshit coffee shop. I love that I can come into the shop, get a great soy latte, and leave without a long wait. Also they roast their own beans in the store!
author: Brittany P.

description: Somethin' about this place I just dig.  Twice now I've come here to work.  Free wi-fi, good coffee and somehow a really good atmosphere to get work done.  I like to have a lot of stuff going on around me while I work.  Keeps my brain distracted while I think.
author: Eric E.

description:
There is almost always a line and a wait to get your coffee here. I still go daily! The coffee is smooth and just fabulous! Their beans are great too.
However, it is a mystery to me why all the electric outputs would be covered, since there is free wi-fi...
author: Nadja B.

description: Very good coffee but this place has too much attitude, and the prices are high (because the cafe is full of people using this as their office). You can buy their coffee beans to go here, or at many other places around the city.
author: Meredith G.

description:
This is possibly the greatest coffee shop I've ever been to. 

Here's why:
1) Grand Comfy Factor
      Don't you get tired of those hard, wooden benches and tables you find at your standard Starbucks/Petes/"Insert Monopoly here".  Theres a spattering of small tables here for you lonesters, but the main table is BIG, expansive, meant for you to sit and MEET people.  Also, there's a slew of couches, as well as some interesting room-like setting in the back.
2) Great music.
      If you're not streaming or our-tuning other people's songs, listen to what they've got playing here.  It's geared to everyone and no one at all, so hopefully you'll pick up something new there.
3) Great staff.
      Not at all pretentious or snobby.  Go there once in a while, and they'll pick up on your name, your regular order, and stop to chew the fat with you when it's not too crazy in there.
4) Fantastic coffee
     Artistry and neat little cups.  Balanced flavor.  Good stuff. 
5) Cheap snacks
     1.00 biscottis are a must.  Check out some of those bars they have some times. 
6) Laptop friendly.
    Ah screw you, anti lap toppers.  Coffee shops are places of play AND work.  For me, they exist so I can work in an environment that's different from my shabby house and get a decent mocha.  I go there just to hang out plenty, but laptop friendlyness is muy important. 
7) Crowd.
     Not at all angry hipsters, unless of course, you're an asshole : ) 
Seriously: It's usually 826 volunteers (great people), students running for a break, or just your regular missioners dragging in their bikes.  Take one of the cards that say "Please sit with me" and meet some new friends. 


This is one of the great coffee shops of the mission. Visit it!
author: Carly S.

description: Valencia coffee. Good vibe. Kinda like granola hippie grandkids that are Valencia hipster, eco-friendly  and sharing caffeine space....Gets crowded, but at least no Marinatypos with LoosyJuicy written out on theirkeesters with blonde threadthrowups vapidly conversing. for that alone, i give it a gracious three stars, for many grassy-asses...or is that spelled graci-ass.
author: miriam b.

description: Coffee is great, but it is so obnoxious that it makes you want to order a grande mocha frappuccino just to piss them off!
author: Bibiana L.

description: who doesn't love an ironic moustache served with their morning coffee?  The boys are hot, the girls can dress, and the coffee is dee-lish.  The only downside:  the missing doorknob on the bathroom door.
author: Paddy G.

description: The drip coffee's amazing... I think it vies with Blue Bottle and Philz for the the top of the SF coffee triumvirate.  Quite hip, and hipster-centric... some were bringing in their fixies and chatting with their friends-employees.  I felt nervous whipping out my non-Apple here to get some work done, not knowing what kind of shunning I would incur.  This isn't the ideal place to get work done, with blasting indie-rock, and many attractive and/or interesting people to look at.
author: Cooper S.

description: I miss this place so very much. Since moving from the city I haven't really been back here much. I lived around the corner from Ritual and just adored it. The staff were always so sweet to me. The coffee was just delicious. And oh, how I miss coming in on a cold day with my laptop and sitting for hours sipping on latte after latte. Ritual, I miss you...
author: Alexa L.

description: I am not a habitual coffee drinker, but the ice latte I had was heavenly - smooth and flavorful.
author: Lillian B.

description: I went here today for a coffee.  Amazing freshly brewed coffee that had so much flavor.  Only bad thing is that it's hard to find a seat on the weekends and it can be real loud, but it definitely has a cool vibe.  If you're a serious coffee drinker, this place is for you.
author: Mitch A.

description: Even the hot chocolates are beautiful (and also damn good). I like the ambiance here, especially in the back. If you can snag the couches, you'll be set up for the night. It's a bit on the hipster side, but SF needed a coffeehouse like this. Will each neighborhood get a Ritual? Let's hope so!
author: Anika K.

description: This place totally fulfills my occasional urges to be a quintessential coffee snob in San Francisco.
author: Geryon R.

description: What's that damn knocking sound?.....That my friends is the sweet sound of fresh espresso grounds being dosed out for an awesome coffee experience. A great cup a joe from baristas that take the care in making your coffee experience well worth the wait. If egg yolks are liquid gold then the coffee here is liquid heaven. Best damn coffee in the city next to Blue Bottle yet still deserves 5 stars. If you're hip, then grab your single speed and yer laptop and plop your ass down for great cup of coffee or two and free wifi.
author: Brian J.

description: 4 stars for the awesome latte'.... -1 for the very long wait...it wasn't even all that crowded.
author: Nancy P.

description: Ritual has helped me understand that coffee is like wine-- the beans make a HUGE difference and the types of flavors can be endless. It is usually busy--but thats ok, no longer than a 10 minute wait.  While waiting in line you can read the descriptions of the different beans they have to offer: who grew them, in what part of the world and what types of flavors you can expect from them.  You wont get that any where else. Its just a great place to get coffee for a true coffee drinker! Enjoy!
author: W B.

description: Did this place change ownership? I used to get my morning coffee at Ritual every day, from the earliest beginnings when they opened as transplants from the Northwest serving Stumptown beans, before they began serving their own stuff.  The owners and staff were friendly, informative and INTERESTED in their customers' in those days. I moved to a different neighborhood a while back and haven't been hanging there as much for the last year or so. Now it looks like they're focusing mostly on drip-brew, those two original owners are nowhere to be seen, and the staff are all Stepford-hipsters with two switches--"ignore" or "disdain."  Even my 25 year old hipster kid who used to take his friends here says the place is just too goofily off-putting to throw down his hard-earned.  Coffee is still really good though.
author: Julie A.

description: Eh, this place is more about the scene than the coffee if you ask me.  Good coffee, nice, talented baristas, don't get me wrong...but I can't handle this much yupster 'tude with my joe.
author: Ky W.

description: I am a coffee lover, like a lot of others, which is why I have tried coffee around the City; this place is one of my favorites!  The coffee is consistently good and Ritual offers vegan pastries, which are always awesome!  If I were to say anything bad about Ritual it would be about the hipsters that frequent this establishment.  Overall, this place is damn good!
author: Jay B.

description: All I'm going to talk about is the latte. It was wonderful. The flavor was rich and deep, but not overpowering. The roast was wonderful, followed by an equally strong effort by the friendly barista, who incidentally had no problems sharing some tips with my barista wanna-be friend who went with me. He took the time to make a magnificent latte. They used organic milk, which adds to the flavor and has an incredible interaction with the espresso. I'm not sure this is the best in the city, but it's close.
author: Erik S.

description: Great coffee, atmosphere, friendly staff. Very comfortable environment.
author: Dani S.

description: I was disappointed with the quality of the coffee here. I ordered a decaf cappuccino. It was average cafe quality, not Blue Bottle or Epicenter quality. Although the cup is small, I couldn't taste the espresso well enough to give a detailed critique. Also, the cappuccino was milky -- more latte than cap.
author: Mark P.

description:
Review just on a plan cup of coffee:  it's....ok.  

Flavor was very good...my problem is that the amount of just pure grind still left in the coffee.  Just looked in my cup and the last 1/5th of the coffee is just pure coffee bean grind/sludge...undrinkable. 

Could be because the attendant used the very last part / pump from one coffee thermos and then switched to a second...so I must have gotten the really bad drudges of the first one...yuck.
author: Jonathan H.

description: The crowd is hip. The Internet is accessible. But the power outlets are blocked off on weekend. LAME!
author: Jesse H.

description: Employees are a bunch of bastards, but there are bastards out there selling everything nowadays, so why not go somewhere that makes great coffee?
author: Nic B.

description: I like this place. It's good. the menu is short, sweet and to the point. my only qualms are that I have yet to go there and be able to find a seat within 5 minutes, and my drink takes another 5 to make and pour. I spend a lot of time waiting.
author: Tanya C.

description:
its nice to be able to order a double with the confidence it will be served right.  it amazes me that in the so-called land of coffee some people still have no idea what a proper espresso tastes like.  this place has got the goods even though i am not all about the espresso blend.  its a bit bright for me.  the only detractor for me was cup of press i received when i ordered a cuppa.  i'm all for french press, but sometimes nothing but a big powerful cup of drip will do.

and i didn't get any attitude.  dude was actually very polite for the amount of people in line.
author: Markus B.

description: The other day my friend's soy latte had smiling, whale-shaped foam.  So...Four stars!
author: Joanna S.

description: Best damn Latte in Northern Cali.  This place convinced me that there's no need to add anything to your coffee once it's been served to you.  After 25 years of drinking coffee, I finally do NOT add sweetener to my coffee.  When I travel, I now look for coffee that can step up to the quality of Ritual,  I even advise other barristas to research how Ritual does their business.
author: Paul C.

description: The best coffee in the city....even under the new ownership. (OK..Blue bottle also Rocks!!!)
author: Blair M.

description: Ritual was brought up to me with the reputation already for slow service, but I consider myself a very patient person and didn't think of anything when going there for the first time today. But man oh man - it got to me! My peace of cake was long gone before my coffee drink was up and no, it was not busy at all there today. It felt like lots of people behind the counter with split role assignment - one for cash, one for drip, one for foam? And not enough space for all to climb over each other. I didn't see the flow at all and that's a bummer. No doubt - the coffee is awesome, but I can buy the beens at Rainbow if I want -  and with the abundance of coffee shops with equal good coffee I will choose the one with good service, too. Sorry Ritual, you got to work on your work flow!
author: Judith B.

description: The coffee here is really good.  These kids know how to make a great cup of coffee.  The only problem with this place is that its filled with douche bags and everyone looks like my friend kate.  Get a haircut hipsters!
author: doug b.

description:
i'm pretty sure no one's gonna read this with 800+ other reviews here - but what the hell.
here are my beefs:
- The coffee is over-rated and over-priced - Blue Bottle is WAY better, as is Four Barrel 
- the staff are insufferably arrogant
- they insist on *leaving the goddam door open* even when its 45° outside - "because of the roast" they say but that's bullshit - it's because they would prefer you don't hang around, doubt me? well how about this...
- they REMOVED ALL THEIR OUTLETS last year - "because it was costing us too much for electricity" - really? DOUBT IT.

so if you want an overpriced underwhelming cup of coffee served up to you by an arrogant pretentious hipster in an establishment that is trying hard to move you along than this is your place. don't forget to lock your fixie.
author: bennett v.

description: Fantastic coffee. The French press is brilliant. Unlike Four Barrel, this is more like a coffee-house where you can actually sit and read or try and work. It gets insanely crowded, so am actually not very sure you could work from here, though -- but there is potential.
author: Premshree P.

description:
New review:
Although what I wrote below is true, one of the staff contacted me to apologize...if they have ettiquite to apologize they don't deserver a 2 star rating.  I have changed my rating from 2 start to 4 star because of this outstanding customer service.



Old Review:


Staff abused me about ordering an espresso long style...just like I did everyday that I lived in Italy.

Just give the customer what they want with little banter unless engaged by the customer--duh--especially when selling first cups of coffee in the morning.

Drip coffee was excellent.

Not enough breakfast items.
author: l p.

description: When I'm in the MIssion, this is where I always try to go to get a decaf mocha.  Theirs is truly mind-blowing, with layers and layers of taste in the decaf espresso.  I can only give them four stars though, since their service is uneven and I've heard reports of very watered-down americanos.
author: Polly M.

description: Mad Tacky ,  I don't want to bog down on this lame (hangout) but you people look kind of skinny/sick .  black doo doo aint right  .
author: Evan M.

description: Pretty much the best coffee and coffee house vibe in the southern half of SF. Excellent pastries, too. But the coffee is paramount. the people behinf the counter are friendly and efficient. the hood is righteous, Marsh theater is just a few doors down, Boogaloo just up the block. frickin' sweet.
author: Zephyr A.

description: my premier spot for studying or working. wi-fi, good music, great coffee and tea.  tasty banana bread.  too bad it closes early.
author: Arcelia G.

description:
I actually love strong coffee, but Ritual's is a bit too strong/burnt for my tastes. I'm from Seattle, but have lived out of the country for a while, so perhaps I've grown unaccustomed to the strong flavor of fresh roast, but I just haven't had any real great cups here. Not horrible though. Good cupcakes however. 

Really long line most of the time too, which is a turnoff. I'm impatient. And it's loud.
author: Gym W.

description: I really, really love Ritual.  The staff is great and I love to bring new people or out of town folk because they are always impressed.  I like to buy the whole bean coffee and grind it at home and they have excellent options.  Since I'm not a sit in a cafe and work on a computer or read type person, the crowds do not bother me as it is a very busy place.  If you like or love coffee, check it out!
author: Kenneth N.

description: What I want from a coffee place is a consistent cup in the morning, when I'm hurrying to work.  I loved Ritual for my own morning ritual.  Namely, their french press coffee.  This morning I found that they had changed.  Copying the other upscale coffee places (Philz, my love) they are now doing by-the-cup drip.  And have raised their prices substantially.  Boo!  It took longer and was not the coffee I had become addicted to.  Motivation to try the other places in the area for my morning cup I guess. So two stars due to my cranky old man disposition towards change in the things I like!
author: Laura V.

description: The coffee is sooo good. I really like the ceramic mugs. But the place smells exactly like the youth shelter where I used to work.  And it's too loud for studying.  Too trendy for me when I am just trying to get homework done.
author: C t.

description: My parents were visiting and since they are both coffee drinkers we took them to Ritual after brunch one Saturday. It was a HIT. They loved their coffee (an Americano and a Latte) so much that they had seconds (which  is a big deal considering that we had just had a huge brunch at Universal Cafe!). They preferred Ritual coffee to Blue Bottle!
author: Writer G.

description: So pretentious. Hipsters, hipsters left and right, not one sincere person in the place.  I can't go to Ritual anymore. The music is often so loud I don't go there with a friend because we can't converse w/o shouting and I won't go there alone because I can't hear myself think and I feel like I'm being judged. Yeah, I'm wearing clothes from BR, so what.
author: Ava S.

description: This place kind of scares me. I feel like I'm walking into a completely silent middle school cafeteria whenever I go there.. and not because of the ambiance. The coffee is good, and the baristas and generally hot/intimidating. I'd give it 5 stars if there was always magically a seat open for me... but in real life, noooo dice!
author: katharine s.

description: Wow!  The best latte I've ever had!  My cousins were right-on when they told me that this is their fav coffee shop in SF.  The texture and consistency of the latte was perfect and so smooth! It was not too foamy, not too flat.  It's too bad they don't have Ritual Coffee in NYC!!
author: Caroline C.

description:
found out that they french press all coffee here, thus, free refills not so much an option.

if you're cray cray for the coffee, and have the time, just go to the creamery in soma (it's on townsend) service waaaay quicker, plus you don't have to maneuver around hipsters trying to get their face on an american apparel billboard.
author: Crystal T.

description: Definitely the place to be...for people and laptops.  It's really crowded and loud, so if that's the kind of cafe environment you want, this is it.
author: Debbie Y.

description: This is amazingly good coffee.  I loved that my latte tasted like a latte, not the steamed milk with a burnt edge I've been experiencing lately.  And I totally want to learn how to make the foamed milk art... these people know their stuff.
author: Nat K.

description: I was so offended on a recent visit that I had to re-write my review.  I ordered a cappuccino.  I watched as the barrista made a perfect latte complete with the little leaf design.  "Double cappuccino" he yelled out.  I stared at him in disbelief.   "That kind of looks like a latte to me."  Without a trace of humor, the barrista says, "We make ours wet, Northwest style. If you don't like it that way, next time you should specify that you want it dry."  What?  Northwest style?  But...  I took the latte and left.  It was an excellent latte.  But I did not order a latte.
author: sarah k.

description:
Truly fantastic coffee.
Ritual has some of the best baristas around - they can draw the flawless leaf pattern in your macchatto, mocha, etc, even with soy milk which (I'm told by my barista friends) is apparently rather difficult.  They've got great chai, which has a nice bite to it and isn't over sweet.  And the mocha?  Wow.  Possibly the best mocha I've had, like, ever.  (gratuitous use of the word 'like', but it's just that necessary)
Tasty array of snacks too, many vegan, many more not.
I thik they may roast their own beans (though their website says they get them from Stumptown in Oregon) and have a ridiculously large selection of them available.  I plan on getting some for my coffee-addicted friends as gifts; I only wish they had some sort of mad gift pack, cuz how am I supposed to choose between the 30 different coffee locations?
Anyway, it's a very Mission sort of joint, with a great ambiance, with constantly changing art on the walls, and these fantastic archaic hanging light bulbs with giant coiled filaments that are some of the coolest looking things ever.  There are a bunch of couches, and free WiFi for your laptoppy happiness.  That is, if you can ever find the space to sit down.  It's almost always over-crowded now, which is too bad, but it's the best coffee for miles so far as I'm aware, and it's become the local trendy scene, so what can you do?
author: Don H.

description:
there seems to be many mixed reviews about this place. maybe i just came on a day when there was a really good barista on bar. anyhow, i really liked the environment in here. lots of seating, people on their laptops, and couches in the back, and the place is filled which is nice. its hard to see coffee shops in the southbay filled with people just hanging out. right before i ordered my drink, the guy at the register went to the wall behind the register and climbed up the bookshelved wall almost to the top, grabbed something, and jumped down. this was pretty funny cuz it showed that the place was laid back and cool.

anyways, to the coffee. that day, i had ordered a espresso and a cappuchino. espresso was pretty good, but the cappuchino was AMAZING. the shot in the cappuchino was perfect, not sour or burnt, and the foam on top of my drink was incorporated so well and tasted very good. too bad my latte art wasn't the best, but whatever! the drink was yum.

i have only been here once but would definitely like to go back whenever i get the chance to hit up the city again.
author: Tiffany K.

description: I had been walking by this place a lot because it's not far from where I live and always seems to be full of peeps.  I went in today and really liked the coffee and atmosphere.  Free wi fi is a nice plus as well.
author: Amy S.

description:
Three and a Half stars.

I like them, I really do. They are quite out of the way for me, and the majority of the patrons exude hipster vibes...which makes me want to run the other way.

But the coffee by ITSELF gets 4.5 stars.
author: Persephone J.

description: This place is awesome, went to find a place to get some work done and people watch.  Their hot chocolate looked as good as it tasted.  I'm still amazed at how laptops seem to be a requirement now for going to a coffee shop, I was just there with a pen and pad. Awesome music.
author: Mark D.

description: Excellent coffee, perfect lattes and macchiatos. They make the foam smooth and silky, not bubbly. It's very loud and crowded in there, but they have wi-fi and the vibe is very Pacific Northwest counterculture hip.
author: Thanya S.

description: Mmm Coffee. I love the smell of this place and the people watching. There's always a line of hipsters spilling out onto the pavement. Fun place to come with a friend, a laptop and ignore each other... Good music and the coffee is good too.
author: Sirima S.

description: 6/13/08: I picked up a couple pounds of the "sweet tooth espresso" and am looking forward to pulling some shots at home.
author: Jesse W.

description: good coffee. as good, if not better than blue bottle. but you do get a whiff of poo poo/something weird smell when you walk in. not sure what that is.... otherwise, good coffee.
author: Paul C.

description:
Great space, if a little smug, and of course the coffee itself is renowned.  I had a cup of Clover-made coffee -- the La Plata blend was delicious.  One day I may even spring for a $7.50 cup of coffee, though for $7.50 I'm not sure I'd be satisfied with anything less than manna from heaven.

They understand details here, from the designs on the mug to the strong graphic signage.  On the other hand, they also have gift cards that say "Sleep with me."  Really?

You can't plug your computer in here (no outlets), but it's a good choice for working until the battery runs out.  It can be difficult to sit here without the self-consciousness of the place and everyone in it sort of seeping into whatever you're doing, but it's worth coming here for the space and the coffee.  You'll know when you visit whether it's a place you'd like to be a regular.
author: S P.

description: I see what they are trying to do.  Ok, that is cool... You are ultra indie.  You let people run shop out of your shop.  I'm into all that "activist coffee".  Problem is that I don't think the coffee is that great.
author: Thadd L.

description: Best soy latte in the city.  Bar none.  Yeah, it's great that you can sit and work on your laptop and check out the cuties for hours on end for the price of a soy latte, but really, it's the soy latte I journey across town for.
author: Cosmolicious L.

description:
warning-- don't let the number or macs and hipsters scare you off--there is substance behind this hype. amazing coffee.. i mean really good f*ckin coffee. and cupcake bites, and delicious teas. oh, they also turned me on to scissors for lefty (local band that i heart) when they were playing their album on a visit.

if you are looking to hanker down for a day this may not be the spot for you since they hare a really limited menu. they are too busy focussing making the perfect cup with a lovely leaf on top in the foam. if your lucky you may get a heart from one of the cuties behind the counter.
author: CTP p.

description:
if the thought of hipsters-on-apple-computers arranged like potted plants makes you woozy, then run.  away.  far away.

self-consciousness and crowds be damned, the coffee is fine (i think they french-press it) and the snacks are savory (spicy cheddar/green onion scone, i pine for you).
author: Kris P.

description: This place definitely cool and hip. It's spacious and clean. The latte I had was good. This is great place to meet up with friends or just to do some work on the laptop.
author: Barney M.

description: Great coffee, but I'm not hip enough to sit in this place.  I'll swing by for a coffee to take out though.
author: Michelle K.

description: Ritual is part of my everyday coffee ritual....Thats right i have 2 cups of coffee before work every day.  May seem like overkill but i work 14 hour days sometimes 7 days a  week and Ritual along w/BB in Hayes Valley fuel my day.   I start off with a Large Soy Latte here (to go) and then do the New Orleans iced at BB.   I really dont understand reviews regarding the staff here everyone here is so friendly and I always get heart shaped latte art.  I heart RITUAL
author: Ellie A.

description: Excellent coffee!  My bf and I wandered over here on a Sunday morning and found a long line out the door, but the line moved quickly and the latte I got was totally worth the wait!  There's really no need to try and cover up the taste of the coffee with flavored syrups or chocolate here . . . it's wonderful to the last drop all on it's own - rich, smooth, nutty, well-balanced, and fabulous!  Yay for Ritual!
author: Amy C.

description: The best coffee in the city for sure - Finally, capuccino as should be and not full of foam. Great cakes,too, excellent latte and really nice atmosphere and music (a lot of vegan dessert choices as well). Everyone has been complaining about the "hipster" aspect of it, but, really staff and clients all seem to be v. friendly.
author: Chris D.

description: Based on taste alone, I give it a three. Not the best I've ever had, but definitely not the worst. You can count on a beautifully made latte here with a taste that is definitely up to par. However, it's not a taste that you'll never forget. What I love about this shop is the environment and the friendly people. Aside from that, well, you've got yourself a nice latte. Nothing more, nothing less.
author: Michelle G.

description:
hipsters? okay whatever. 
too crowded? umm isn't that a good sign? 

this place is well worth putting up with whatever you re whining about and sitting down, relaxing with a good book or great friend and having one of the best cups of coffee in all of san francisco. 
and the cute designs in the foam are a nice touch.
author: Chelsea H.

description: great place to have espresso drinks but french press coffee can be inconsistent at times.  service is normally good but few exceptions to the rule.  usually very crowded so even though it is a great place to hang you may not be able to all the time,
author: brian l.

description: I came to Ritual for the first time yesterday with a friend who has been raving about it, and I was not disappointed!  There was a line out the door and no tables available (it was a Sunday afternoon), but it was totally worth it.  This is the best espresso I've tasted in the city.  I had a latte and it was amazing!  The flavor was perfect and they made pretty art with the foam.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who appreciates great espresso.
author: Karen L.

description: Their espresso and clover coffee own. Their staff is very friendly, and down to talk coffee nerd. They have very interesting and hard to find beans there as well. This is a new must when I am visiting SF.
author: Brian C.

description: if left to my own devices, i probably would've headed elsewhere when i saw the long line snaking out the door.  because, well, i'm not someone who cares overly much about her coffee.  i mean, i'm pretty sure i don't like the taste of burnt beans or the last dregs of any kettle, but other than that coffee is usually just coffee...something to drink because i don't do tea but still like the occasional hot beverage.  so if i'm gonna brave a line on a somewhat cloudy, light rainy day, it'd better be some damn good coffee or have a taste that educates my unsophisticated palette in some way.  sadly, my latte was neither here nor there.  it just was.  which kinda annoyed me but was forgivable given the friendly staff (sorry, barristas) and welcoming atmosphere.
author: Tina E.

description: Apparently brand spankin' new, this place rocks. The coffee was great and I'm obsessed with the design. The space is huge... I have no idea how they can afford it. It also looks like they have an outdoor garden area, which isn't open yet but hopefully will be soon. And on the way out I noticed they had freshly-frosted cupcakes. Yum!
author: Megan P.

description: The oh so hip crowd is countered by good coffee (not the best I've had), the coolest light bulbs I've ever seen, a nice mix of small tables and communal tables as well as groovy red and black commie branding. Oh and it's really the wireless that brings em in and keeps em. Great for working.
author: Susie W.

description: I'm not in this part of town a lot, but I was happy to check out Ritual on a friend's recommendation. We went late Sunday morning, and the place was packed, so even though we thought the space was nice, we didn't feel like hanging around for a table. However, we really enjoyed the coffee (to go).
author: Joel A.

description: Really good coffee...but a bit too crowded for me.  Love the wi-fi in there though.  it's a sea of hipsters with macs.
author: Julia H.

description: I'm sure that most of the images found through the Flickr tag "latte art" were taken here. But not only is the coffee pretty, it's probably some of the best espresso I've had in the city. I've tossed out all my other coffee and now only fill my french press with their Ethiopian Sidoma. I've never actually "hung out" here, since they don't let you plug in your computer (Not to mention I would probably be drawn and quartered for brining in my ThinkPad), so I can't say much about the scene. But if you're looking for a damn good cup of coffee, this is the place to get it.
author: Morgan S.

description:
if ritual didn't serve the only good coffee in SF, no one would go there. 

but it does. 

and we do.

the owners are fab too
author: Erika Y.

description: It's great to go look at hipsters and nothing but mac notebooks. Glowing white apples as far as the eye can see! Their coffee ain't too shabby either. I got in and got served no problem and I don't even have a fixie! I'm pretty sure they saw me pull up with gears and everything. All kidding aside...good coffee and pretty mellow vibe for a place that's so busy. Get a cup and then go sit in the sun in Dolores. Bring the ipod. You won't be sorry.
author: Sterling R.

description:
everything is perfect here.
air, light, sound, art, barista IQ's, wifi, mini-cupcakes, latte, and most importantly: "welcome to san francisco" when i asked, "where am i?  i mean, what neighborhood is this?"
author: Tammy N.

description: The best coffee EVAR!  I don't hang out...don't do the see and be seen.  Just want FLAVOR!  Thanks Jocelyn (Calabria) for reminding me that there is another heaven in SF, too!
author: Sandy K.

description: So I'm probably not the most disciminating coffee connoisseur, but I really enjoyed my latte...and I'm assuming the virtually omnipresent line of people there do too.  I don't actually live in SF, but whenever I'm there, I usually make my way to Boogaloo's for brunch (see review) and will meander over to Ritual for a coffee afterwards.  Their lattes aren't too strong nor do I find them bitter as I do at some other shops.  Just rich, roasted, nutty goodness...in a cup...
author: Jason L.

description: I've been looking for a replacement for my beloved Lux (http://www.yelp.com/biz/lux-coffeebar-phoenix) since the day I arrived in SF. Ritual is as close as it comes, with a cleaner and larger space but nothing like the velvet or mocha at Lux, and with rather sucky music. Still, Ritual makes a pretty damn good latte and is a comfortable place to read or work on the laptop. Send the baristas to train at Lux and we'll have ourselves a winner right here in SF!
author: Will A.

description: Overpriced, some of the baristas can cop a serious attitude, and did I mention the wait???????  Let me put it this way....boogaloos has skipped over my name waiting for a mocha.  Le sigh.  Seriously great mocha but the other stuffs makes me mad.
author: Suzanne C.

description: Their coffee gives me a really great buzz. These people are coffee fanatics, and I've seen the barista championship that proves it.  I'm not into the vibes inside, not so much because of the hipsters, but it just doesn't feel inviting. And I do like the vegan doughnuts.
author: Brittany L.

description: The baristas are always smiling, like they enjoy their job, which makes waiting in line for my decent mocha worthwhile.  Fortunately, I mostly sit in coffee shops to draw comics, so I'm not as put-out by their lack of power outlets as others may be.  I dropped off one star because their coffee isn't the best in town and another star dropped off because they removed the couches from the back to make room for their large sacks of coffee beans.  I used to enjoy cozying up on the back couch with my mocha to draw.  This place just isn't as appealing sitting in a wooden chair or cuddling up with a stranger on the limited couch space.  Though I suppose some folks might add a star for the latter!  ;-)
author: Melaina E.

description: I was looking forward to trying this place. The cappuccino was only so-so. Way too milky.
author: pineapple l.

description: Great coffee. If you are looking for a place to sit down with a computer, this is it.
author: Scott F.

description:
I have a bit of a South Bay bias and prefer Barefoot coffee to anything in the city but this place ranks up there along with Blue Bottle. The latte art is often a sign of a good espresso shot and properly steamed milk. If you mess up the grind or the tamping, you won't get the proper crema to do the pattern. Mess up the micro-foam and it either becomes too milky or too frothy. Ritual certainly hits the mark. And despite not having added any sugar, the resulting cup was still pretty sweet.

The atmosphere is nice (though seating is a bit limited) and the free wireless internet is always a plus.
author: Jeff H.

description: 10 stars for the coffee.  5 stars for the ambience (plenty of seating, but a bit stark).  Hit or miss on service.  Most servers/cashiers have a "I'd rather be anywhere doing anything but this miserable job for no money" vibe and it's hard not empathize with what must be drudgery and below minimum wage salaries.
author: Wesley H.

description: i buy my beans here. yay.
author: krys s.

description: amazing!  I live a few blocks away and have been searching for good coffee on Valencia and finally found it!  Best latte ever, clean space and enjoyed the decor.
author: Briana B.

description: Good location. Excellent Coffee, decent prices. Nice environment, but can get a little noisy. My friend who is a real coffee person loves it!
author: Sean C.

description: Great spot to go and work and sip on coffee. Very much like Victorla in Seattle!
author: Lily K.

description: yelp has power, yelp is a voice that is heard.  months ago I thought of wrtiing a slam of Ritual - not with issues on the coffee - but the service.  I had the expereince of being served by staff who could not be bothered, the very worst of the pretentious Missiojn hipster scene - am I really catching attitude from a twig skinny guy wearing a polyester print from Goodwill?  but I returned yesterday and maybe it was the time of day - the lack of crowd, the heat - whatever - the staff was much better.  the woman at the counter was still a bit officious and the woman who made my coffee was a doll.  she chatted with me and did not even mind a question on her tattoo.  and let's be honest - is there any more delicately roasted coffee beans in this city?  the flavors are so refined and elegant that people who have been burning their tongues on Peet's over roasted brews for years will have an adjustment to make. This is coffee where you really do taste things like citrus and pear.
